intro: Wendlandia jingdongensis, commonly known as the Jingdong bellflower, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to purple. The plant typically grows in mountainous regions and thrives in cool, moist environments. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of flowers during the summer months. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
